elements.label: list_item
elements.text: 2. Figure 4-68 shows the Visual Explain of the same SQL statement, but with RCAC enabled. It is clear that the implementation of the SQL statement is more complex because the row permission rule becomes part of the WHERE clause.

elements.label: picture
elements.text: Diagram showing Visual Explain with RCAC enabled, including Nested Loop Join, Table Scan, Table Probe, Index Probe, Fetch N Rows, Union all, Logic, and And.

elements.label: caption
elements.text: Figure 4-68  Visual Explain with RCAC enabled

elements.label: list_item
elements.text: 3. Compare the advised indexes that are provided by the Optimizer without RCAC and with RCAC enabled. Figure 4-69 shows the index advice for the SQL statement without RCAC enabled. The index being advised is for the ORDER BY clause.

elements.label: picture
elements.text: Screenshot of Index and Statistics Advisor showing index advice with no RCAC.

elements.label: caption
elements.text: Figure 4-69  Index advice with no RCAC

elements.label: page_footer
elements.text: Chapter 4. Implementing Row and Column Access Control: Banking example 77
